info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 7:34PM CDT until March 31 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN OGLE...NORTHERN DE KALB...WINNEBAGO...WESTERN MCHENRY AND BOONE COUNTIES... At 734 PM CDT, a severe squall line capable of producing both tornadoes and extensive straight line wind damage was located along a line extending from near Durand to near Rockford to near Davis Junction, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. These dangerous storms will be near... Loves Park, Machesney Park and Rockton around 740 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these tornadic storms include Roscoe, Candlewick Lake, Timberlane, Poplar Grove, Capron, Harvard and Marengo. Including the following interstates... I-39 between mile markers 108 and 123. I-90 between mile markers 1 and 37. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
